inoffensive scent safe for all occasions. Almost smells like fresh linen, dry down smells like a fabric softener you buy in those small packs. Harbours a nice sweetness to it while keeping it light enough in the high heat</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1814707"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1814707#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1813911" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1813911" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BrilloPadLover"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1433593"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1433593.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BrilloPadLover" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Uden-6306.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6306.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Uden"title="Uden"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1813911ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1813911" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1433593">BrilloPadLover</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-20">04/20/23 23:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've owned this fragrance bottle for a while now, and it's a SWEET yet clean scent. Recently, I asked my girlfriend to give it a sniff, and to my surprise, she said it reminded her of bubble gum. It's interesting because "bubble gum sweet" is a common description used by the fragrance community to describe this scent, and she didn't know that beforehand. Despite this, the fragrance is highly complimented due to its sweetness and strong projection, so it's essential not to overspray. If there's one thing Paco Rabanne is good at, it's crafting perfect fuckboy scents. Not saying I'm one I just happened to buy this fragrance before I really got into fragrances. I think this is my top guilty pleasure...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1813911"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1813911#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1810222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1810222" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fin710"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1724972"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fin710" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1810222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1810222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1724972">fin710</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-16">04/16/23 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great gym / sports scent, decent longevity of around 6 hours and around double that when sprayed on your clothes, reformulations have taken away some of its longevity however. Currently own a newer 100ml, used to own a 50ml from the travel set which had much better longevity and projection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1810222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1810222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808793" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808793" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Afc_Croatian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370156"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1370156.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Afc_Croatian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-Intense-62318.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62318.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre Intense"title="Libre Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808793ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808793" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370156">Afc_Croatian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-14">04/14/23 10:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Before I was a fragrance collector, I always wore Zara Seoul out to the clubs, to gatherings etc. And I almost always got a compliment. From a little $18 bottle, I thought this was the best thing ever.<br />
Years later and I discover that it was a clone to Paco Rabane's Invictus and I knew I had to get a full bottle of it.<br />
<br />
Such brilliance, there is no denying that Invictus reached its target audience. You can assume they want the younger crowd wearing it, sure. But it's great at being fun, loud, sweet and playful, that bubblegum opening never gets old.<br />
<br />
Like it or not, there is no denying Invictus' monster presence to fragrance users, collector or not, you have either worn it or come across it for good reason. It's attention-seeking, fruity-citruses.<br />
<br />
It seems to last surprisingly long (6+ hours), and to this day, Invictus deserves a spot in my collection.<br />
<br />
8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1808793"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1808793#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1802975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1802975" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bronstet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698991"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bronstet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1802975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1802975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698991">Bronstet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-07">04/07/23 10:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>* Groundbreaking fresh and sweet scent with refreshing citrus opening and powder on the drydown <br />
* Great youthful cologne that honors the original Paco Rabanne Pour Homme in its DNA<br />
* Extremely good performance<br />
* Despite it's own marketing, is actually a great unisex fragrances for both men and women<br />
* Great for all seasons<br />
<br />
* Is bested by its own flankers, especially Aqua and Platinum, and the well received gourmand oriented Victory<br />
* Is suffering from backlash due to its own popularity; a victim of its own success<br />
* Derided for its youthful appeal, ironic given Paco Rabanne Pour Homme's status as an old person's cologne<br />
* Not suitable for older men and formal occasions<br />
<br />
Ah, the original Invictus. This is a great cologne with a lot of publicity and hype behind it and IMHO justifiably so. It brought the Paco Rabanne name to a younger audience and made a huge impact in the market by doing so. Let me put it this way: I was introduced to the Invictus line by my 16 year old nephew and it was love at first scent. <br />
<br />
This is fresh, sweet, citrusy on the opening and powdery on the drydown. The drydown clearly has Paco Rabanne Pour Homme's DNA all over it. Performance is exceptional with very strong projection, silliage and longevity. Invictus pays tribute to its predecessor while forging the future. It has earned every bit of its success. <br />
<br />
Invictus is suffering from some backlash nowadays as it has become derided as too youthful and not a serious cologne which is ironic as its forefather Paco Rabanne Pour Homme is considered an old man's cologne. I see where people are coming from, but this product was necessary for Paco Rabanne. They were never going to bring in new generations of users with the respected but dated original. I don't think the backlash is fully justified, but I will agree that Invictus is not appropriate for older more mature men in their 50s and older.<br />
<br />
For everyone else, Invictus is great all weather fragrance suitable for almost any activity except a formal occasion. And despite what it's own marketing would have you believe, women can wear this too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1802975"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1802975#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799819" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799819" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Catacal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1510021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Catacal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799819ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799819" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510021">Catacal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 19:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The combination of everything makes it smell like a bubblegum scent off the bat. I haven't worn it in a while and have drifted off to stronger scents. Kinda smells like a weak Libre. Would be a solid warm weather gym frag that I'll be happy to put into my gym rotation.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1799819"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1799819#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1786133" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1786133" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HannahRosesAreRed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1705684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HannahRosesAreRed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Bubble-Bath-60105.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60105.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bubble Bath"title="Bubble Bath"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1786133ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1786133" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684">HannahRosesAreRed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-17">03/17/23 17:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a freshie kind of gal. I love wearing them on myself, and I'd be very happy to smell them on a guy, if not even more so. Out of curiosity, I decided to test this oft-loved and oft-reviled men's fragrance. I'm surprised it's as polarizing as it is, because I find it quite pleasant! This is a pretty straightforward aquatic cologne with a slew of conventional, but appealing accords. The citrus, sharp grapefruit it there, but just a hint. Think of it as the twist in this aquatic freshie cocktail. The rest of "Invictus" is pure oceanic marineand I have to say, I dig it. <br />
<br />
"Invictus" is a deeper, cooler, more full-bodied marine as opposed to, say, Dolce &amp; Gabbana's "Light Blue," which is more lemony fresh. It's definitely true to the marine theme and accords, which I theorize may be the reason for its controversial reception. It does have salty ambergris at its base, which infamously lends an animalic, briny, old seaweed smell to whatever fragrance it's featured in. I personally don't mind it here, since it's used as a base. I also suspect the earthy, muddy and herbaceous notes of oakmoss and patchouli are also turn-offs for some. But for me, I enjoy it. (It seems patchouli is a repeat offender in most fragrances I like. Could I be a patchouli fan and not know it?)<br />
<br />
Other than that, I overall really enjoy this slightly herby and very refreshing men's fragrance. I think it's that gentle hint of white floral and bay leaf that does it for me, on top of the appealing ozone opener. My only real complaint is the design of the bottle, which is a tad awkward to spray. Otherwise, I enjoy this, but as always with perfume in generaltest the waters first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1786133"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1786133#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784495" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ye Naing"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508640"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ye Naing" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508640">Ye Naing</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-15">03/15/23 19:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Apart from great longivity and sillage, I hate this fragrance, I dont like opening and drydown as well.<br />
Headach inducer for me and want to scrub it off.<br />
I love all Paco Rabbane fragrance, except this one.<br />
I have and happened to love all 1 million flankers and pure XS night.<br />
Invitus victory is different though, I like it and its a perfume version of pure xs night which I love but performance suck and victory fullfill my wish.<br />
I hate also Rasasi Howas which most people loved and enjoyed.<br />
May be Invitus and Hawas are not my type.<br />
I collected them but I will never use them again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1784495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1784495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1780358" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JuanManuel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1548175"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1548175.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JuanManuel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/The-One-for-Men-Eau-de-Parfum-31909.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31909.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The One for Men Eau de Parfum"title="The One for Men Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1780358ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1780358" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1780358"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1780358#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1779831" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1779831" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vape"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1672182"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1672182.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vape" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Layton-39314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Layton"title="Layton"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1779831ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1779831" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1672182">Vape</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-10">03/10/23 03:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a triple pack Paco Rabanne tester with the latest version of 1 million (which I used to wear 15 years ago) Phantom and Invictus - which with all the hype was the main reason I picked it up.<br />
TBH - I didn't really take to any of them (although I do still like 1 Million Prive) Out of the three, this was the one I disliked the most. I really don't like this at all, it's too young, BLUE and sweet for me, but at 48 perhaps I'm not meant to!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1779831"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1779831#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1779398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1779398" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="laundrybasinmustard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348243"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="laundrybasinmustard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Fils-de-Dieu-du-riz-et-des-agrumes-14560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Dieu du riz et des agrumes"title="Fils de Dieu du riz et des agrumes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1779398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1779398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348243">laundrybasinmustard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-09">03/09/23 13:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get a lot of compliments wearing this one, up to several hours after one spray. <br />
<br />
If your audience is other people, which it always is to some extent unless you are asexual, it's a high-value choice.  Easy pick for your nephew in his teens or 20s.  <br />
<br />
I don't tend to choose it on days when I wear cologne for myself, because the drydown on my skin is 100% the "powder" note, and I just don't really like that scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1779398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1779398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1778614" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1778614" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lorddom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701976"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1701976.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lorddom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1778614ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1778614" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701976">lorddom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-08">03/08/23 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strong and sweet EDT that i had for years and ultimately gave away when moving. It had its purpose, being worn for high-intensity sports, but that was about it. It's too strong imo for casual wear, so I didn't get that far into the bottle despite owning it for six years. Strength is impressive, sure, but other than that it's not anything I'd salivate over. The name and bottle are what carries this parfum for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1778614"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1778614#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1777205" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1777205" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="grantnhaynes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670567"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="grantnhaynes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Armaf/Club-de-Nuit-Intense-Man-34696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Club de Nuit Intense Man"title="Club de Nuit Intense Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1777205ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1777205" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670567">grantnhaynes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-07">03/07/23 06:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this cologne and I don't understand why people hate on it so much. It lasts, long, smells fresh and isn't too expensive. This was my first cologne and I have so many memories with me wearing this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1777205"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1777205#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18471" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1279357" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1279357" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243955"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1243955.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexandria-Fragrances/Nostalgia-47894.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47894.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nostalgia"title="Nostalgia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1279357ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1279357" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243955">Gom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-21">01/21/21 06:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Honestly fragrantica is full of all these tryhard uber quirky hipsters who brigade fragrances like these and pretend they like these abstract niche goat turd scents. This smells fine, if you're young the people around you will like this, If you're hitting your late twenties its probably not for you. Theres a reason its popular it just smells fresh and sweet there isnt an unlikable note in this. <br />
Very dissapointed in the fragrantica community.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1279357"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1279357#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent429111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc429111" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cassiano"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6218.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cassiano" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Spicy-Aoud-41075.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41075.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spicy Aoud"title="Spicy Aoud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma429111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd429111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6218">Cassiano</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-23">11/23/13 11:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>From the market point of view, there are several types of colognes users: those who little understand (or understand just the basics), seeking only a good scent, and the fragrance addicts, art scholars, who want to know the story behind each creation. Doing a comparison, in a more simplistic way, I would say it's the same thing that happens with consumers who buy a product by price or brand and those who give preference to environmentally friendly products, organic, etc.<br />
<br />
Within this context, before speaking about the fragrance itself, with its notes and impressions, it is important to speak of the concept and the marketing activity that exists behind this release. Because, since the launch of Ultraviolet for Men (1999) - with its bolder scent - and the sales success of Black XS (2005), the brand reached a completely different male audience than was usual until then, with the faithful users of the classic Paco Rabanne for Men (1973). As a result, the brand began to be envisioned by younger men, eager for more modern, nocturnal, and differentiated colognes. And the latest releases prove this: 1 Million, 1 Million Intense, Black XS Lexces, in addition to the full range of women's fragrances, which followed the same trend.<br />
<br />
Invictus hits the market to perform more than personal satisfaction. It comes with the responsibility of supporting personal projects of sportsmen from all over the world, involving internet users, in its Invictus Award. Basically, it is a competition in which were gathered seven athletes, from seven distinct nationalities, practitioners of different sports to experience challenges and persuade the internet users to vote for them, in pursuit of the prize of 50 thousand dollars, to be reversed in the realization of their social projects. The winner of the first season (Yes, there will be a second season!) was Ricardo Carpentieri, a Brazilian jiu-jitsu instructor who lives in Milan for some years.<br />
<br />
Once you understand the story that exists behind this release, it becomes easier to understand the creation of the advertising campaign that brought, as a representative of this concept of "invincibility", the Australian sportsman Nick Youngquest, who helped guide the candidates during the whole competition, was their mentor, transmitted the values of sport, etc.<br />
<br />
Now, let's talk about the fragrance: forget any attempt to compare it with 1 Million! Invictus is a cologne of fresh and sensual aspects. I would put it into a fruity-woody classification, which is composed of notes of grapefruit peel, marine accord, and Bay leaves, balanced by notes of patchouli, ambergris, and guaiac wood.<br />
In time: some specialized websites list other notes, such as Mandarin orange (output), Jasmine (in the heart), and oakmoss (at the base). However, this information does not exist on the official website and therefore I think it is unfounded.<br />
<br />
The aroma of grapefruit peel and bay leaves is very rich in the first few minutes, while the marine accord gives a certain freshness that permeates throughout the evolution. After about 20 minutes, the fruity tone gives way to the sweet brilliance of ambergris, coupled with the creamy-smoky of the guaiac wood. It is worth mentioning that the sweet tone of ambergris is very synthetic, even because, it has been reproduced in the laboratory in recent years. Anyway, the fragrance can be quite versatile, thanks to its marine content.<br />
<br />
Finally, I couldn't let talking about the bottle. Although it seems to me that there is a movement to simplify the bottles of today, making them very straight, cylindrical and/or discolored, Paco Rabanne still believes in the legend (beyond true) that a large part of worldwide sales of perfumes is due to the beauty and creativity of their bottles, together with what the fragrance represents. And in this case, the bottle has everything to do with the topic, in addition to being much more beautiful closely than in the pictures in the media.<br />
<br />
Working with a median projection and lasting very well, Invictus is beautiful inside and out, which makes it a real trophy to your collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="429111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=429111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent681439" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc681439" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Seattle Dweller"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.984642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Seattle Dweller" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Outlands-97924.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97924.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Outlands"title="Outlands"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma681439ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd681439" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984642">Seattle Dweller</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-02-26">02/26/16 01:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's been out for 3 years and it's popularity is slowing down. All the more reason for people to revisit it. <br />
<br />
I liked it when I tested a while back and purchased a small bottle 2 weeks ago. The bottle is cheesy and Invictus is slightly over priced. <br />
<br />
It's funny reading all the negative reviews.  These are the same people that wished One million didn't have a bubble gum smell, had a fresher summer citrus vibe for added versatility, and a mature woody aquatic note.<br />
<br />
Guess what? that's exactly what Invictus is and they still complain. <br />
<br />
Imo this fragrance ticks a lot of boxes and avoids pitfalls that would make girls dislike it.  <br />
<br />
Musky smokey old man vibe?  Nope.  <br />
Thick cologny after shave stench?  Nope. <br />
Pine smell like a cheap car freshner?  Nope. <br />
Bad leather odor like old shoes?  Nope. <br />
Toilette bowl mint smell like Versace Eros? Nope. <br />
<br />
Like many Paco Rabanne fragrances this is sweet, lasts a long time and girls love it. <br />
<br />
<b>Score = 7/10<b> Invictus Aqua = 8 out of 10</b></b></p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="681439"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=681439#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1189918" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1189918" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sergiuniculescu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1217582"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1217582.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sergiuniculescu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boucheron/Boucheron-Singulier-76761.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76761.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boucheron Singulier"title="Boucheron Singulier"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1189918ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1189918" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1217582">sergiuniculescu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-18">06/18/20 10:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Guess what? It's 2020 and I've never smelled Invictus because of hatred and negative reviews like it's a kid's scent, ultra generic, pure synthetic, etc.. So today I ordered it blind-buy. <br />
I am very flexible, I'm a big fan of Fahrenheit, Kouros, Azzaro pour Homme, Versace the Dreamer, Paco Rabanne Pour Homme, but I also prefer Versace Dylan Blue, Eros, Prada LR Carbon or Versace pour Homme.<br />
It should arrive tomorrow. Will see! <br />
_____<br />
Later Edit:<br />
I've been wearing invictus for five days in a row now. This is addictive! Works in every situation: office, jogging, cycling, drinking a beer with the lads, going shopping, running errands or simply staying at home, this is perfect! Plus my wife loving it. <br />
Very good havy projection 3h+ and 12h+ longevity. If I stick my nose to the skin I can smell this even after 24h. Now I'm sorry that I lost 7 years not wearing Invictus! Absolutely love this! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1189918"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1189918#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1090577" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1090577" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BigThirteen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1190828"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1190828.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BigThirteen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1090577ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1090577" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1190828">BigThirteen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-23">08/23/19 05:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The people who hate this secretly deep down inside them love it so much it hurts. <br />
This fragrance is impossible to hate. <br />
Its beyond amazing and you know its one of the legends for compliments. <br />
Will ALWAYS have a bottle in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="1090577"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=1090577#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18471" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent996584" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc996584" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cioraniada"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1150027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cioraniada" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-430.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.430.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male"title="Le Male"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma996584ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd996584" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150027">Cioraniada</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-01">11/01/18 07:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lesson I learned on this site: Buy all the fragrances with the most dislikes from the fragrance snobs and geeks, wear them, swoop all the beautiful girls, meanwhile the geeks are trying to find the most unique niche scents that smell like a grandma and don't get any action. LOL<br />
<br />
EDIT: Banter aside, am I the only one that get a Creed Original Santal vide from this ? Very, very similar IMHO</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="996584"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=996584#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent525387" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc525387" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NeoXerxes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/801820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NeoXerxes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Dia-Man-1110.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1110.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dia Man"title="Dia Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma525387ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd525387" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/801820">NeoXerxes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-23">09/23/14 01:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Paco Rabanne has finally outdone himself! He has somehow managed to produce a fragrance that is even worse than 1 Million. Despite sharing a name with one of the most excellent poems of all time, Invictus is cloyingly sweet, gratingly synthetic, and in the end, reminiscent of Axe/Lynx body spray. Worse still, the composition would be utterly forgettable were it not so brash.<br />
<br />
As for presentation, the bottle may be considered a marginal improvement over the ludicrously false luxury represented by 1 Million's gold bar. However, prospective buyers should keep in mind that by purchasing Invictus, they are actually paying for a trophy - a hideous trophy that represents nothing more than the sad triumph of mass materialism over perfumery as an art.<br />
<br />
Shameless on all accounts. <br />
<br />
Avoid at all costs.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="525387"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=525387#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent410809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc410809" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aleccsei"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/503248"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.503248.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aleccsei" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/APOM-Pour-Femme-6805.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6805.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="APOM Pour Femme"title="APOM Pour Femme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma410809ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd410809" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/503248">Aleccsei</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-28">09/28/13 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm sorry to say, but it's incredibly cheap and soapy. For some people, this might be something worth while, but It's not my case.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="410809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=410809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent529402" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc529402" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wesleyhclark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.410918.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wesleyhclark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alfa-Romeo-Perfumes/Black-70093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black"title="Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma529402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd529402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918">wesleyhclark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-06">10/06/14 10:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It opens with that horrible, synthetic, not at all convincing grapefruit note I have smelled way too often in modern mainstream perfumery (Hermes Eau de Pamplemousse Rose gets grapefruit right - this one doesn't), and closes with an equally annoying marine scent that sours on me very quickly.<br />
<br />
This stuff is nasty and repulsive, cheap-smelling and common. It's a cacophony of unfortunate ingredients. And, what's more, its mother dressed it funny in a silly bottle that looks like the little plastic "just being there" awards my kids used to bring home from elementary school.<br />
<br />
Paugh. <br />
<br />
("Haters gotta hate." Translation: "I don't agree with you." Can we please retire this phrase?)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="529402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=529402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent533872" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc533872" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Le_Coeur_Gothique"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/355025"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.355025.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Le_Coeur_Gothique" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ulric-de-Varens/Version-Black-19180.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19180.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Version Black"title="Version Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma533872ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd533872" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/355025">Le_Coeur_Gothique</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-21">10/21/14 08:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Four figures enter the lab. One of them is Dominique Ropion. Dominique Ropion for chrissakes! He has created Ysatis... And Amarige... And Kenzo's Jungles... And Krazy Krizia...<br />
He's surrounded by three other perfumers. They have not created anything near as legendary, partially because they're younger, but since they were chosen by the master, it can't be, they must be of some considerable worth and potential.<br />
The perfume world is holding its breath.<br />
And after what seems to be a strenuous effort of taming the extracts, the resins and the oils, an effort from which nothing less than a masterpiece should be expected, they give us...Invictus.<br />
...<br />
Really guys? No, I'm serious, really? Did this storm in a teacup really require the combined efforts of four to create it? <br />
It's not a horrendous fragrance per se, but come on! I could make a better scent in an afternoon.<br />
"But... But this marvellous blast of marine notes topped with delicious grapefruit and crowned with laurel..."<br />
Yeah, right...<br />
Believe me, I know of marine notes, I'm from Greece. These are not marine notes. This is a chemical mess! Not a single person who lives by the sea would perceive this cacophony as "marine". And if the laurel was a hint about its ancient use of wreathing champions with it, it's unfortunately only the grapefruit's bitterness that leaves its aftertaste in the end. And I don't mean in olfactory terms...<br />
And Invictus? For reals? Who were its opponents during its struggle to the title? Nothingness and complete incompetence? It wouldn't last a single round against any of the dudes of Paco Rabanne's glorious past. And I don't mean 1 Million, cause it wouldn't stand a chance against it either. <br />
As for its bottle, unless it's a joke, it's kitsch redefined. It reminds me of something "Made in an Asian sweatshop" that could be found in a souvenir shop with "You are the champ!" written on it. Or a promotional table lighter on the desk of an underground car repair shop. Made in an Asian sweatshop as well.<br />
Oh wait! Wasn't it Avon that paved the way for funny looking bottles? At least Avon bottles achieved a certain cult status over time, while this bloody poseur seems to really expect us to be stunned by its gravitas right from the start.<br />
And to add insult to injury, three out of four noses did the same with Burberry's Brit Rhythm, another benchmark of mediocrity and "forgotten in a heartbeat" quality. In the same year! The whole thing reminds me of some travelling sideshow, blaring about the wonders you'll behold by entering its tent, but all you'll see by doing so, are some miserable fake monsters made of plaster and badly painted. I guess Veronique Nyberg had some dignity left and jumped off the caravan before its downward spiral hit the bottom...<br />
The only positive thing about it is that it spares me the chore of writing a review for Burberry's Brit Rhythm (what an "inspired" name!), cause by simply reversing the names and subtracting Veronique Nyberg from this unholy equation, there, you have it already!<br />
<br />
P.S.: I'm sure that some younger readers will go livid on me, but I'm afraid I can't stress enough how someone who has smelled Paco Rabanne pour Homme and Tnr in their heyday feels about today's releases...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18471"comment_id="533872"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html?ccid=533872#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18471" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="18471":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="18471" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>
</div></div></div>

        </a>

        <a href="/perfume/Rabanne/Invictus-18471.html#cc2372104"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Rabanne</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Invictus</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="I absolutely love this cologne in my opinion I think it&#039;s one of the best mens fragrances out there it&#039;s so versatile it could be worn all year round and it&#039;s such a wonderful smell definitely top 5 for me of all time.             <em>DaFragMan</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.2147863.jpg"
                                                     style="width: 2em; height: 2em; border-radius: 1em"></span>
    </div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">

        customize_colors:"Colors",
        customize_charts_size:"Charts size",
    }

    let pulseLangVariables = {
        pulse:"Fragrantica Pulse",

    }

    let done_flickity = false;
</script>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
